Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: எரியால் சுடப்படினும் உய்வுண்டாம் உய்யார் பெரியார்ப் பிழைத்தொழுகு வார்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Though burnt by a fire (from a forest), one may perhaps live; (but) never will he live who has shown disrespect to the great (devotees).

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A split composition. On the left, a person is shown caught in a raging forest fire ('எரியால் சுடப்படினும்'). It is a terrible situation, but a small, clear path of escape is visible, showing that survival is possible ('உய்வுண்டாம்').
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the right, another person is shown having committed an offense against a great, wise, and powerful sage ('பெரியார்ப் பிழைத்தொழுகுவார்').
Layered_Composition.Background: The sage is not attacking them. However, the consequence of their offense is shown to be a metaphysical one: the very path of life before the offender has completely vanished into a black, inescapable void. There is no possibility of survival ('உய்யார்'). The offense has erased their future.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: One might be able to survive being burnt by a great fire, but there is no survival for one who offends the truly great.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The contrast between the physical threat (fire) with a path of escape, and the metaphysical threat (offending the great) with no path of escape, is the key. The vanishing path of life is the visual for certain doom.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Certain doom, inescapable consequence, comparing physical and spiritual danger.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The fire scene is chaotic and red. The scene with the sage is supernaturally calm, but the black void is utterly terrifying and absolute.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A side-by-side composition that starkly contrasts the two scenarios.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Contrasting lighting: chaotic firelight vs. the absolute, light-absorbing black of the void.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: High-fantasy art, with a metaphysical horror element.

Cultural_Anchors: Surviving a fire is possible ('எரியால் சுடப்படினும் உய்வுண்டாம்')
No survival for one who offends the great ('பெரியார்ப் பிழைத்தொழுகுவார் உய்யார்')
The supreme danger of disrespecting spiritual power.
